meanings.definition: a person living near or next door to the speaker or person referred to
meanings.sent1: My friendly neighbor always waves when I see him outside.
meanings.sent2: I borrowed some sugar from my neighbor yesterday.
meanings.sent3: My neighbor's cat thinks it owns the whole neighborhood!
meanings.sent4: The relationship between a good book and its reader is like that of a neighbor and a friend.
meanings.sent5: The neighbor's barking dog kept me up all night.

meanings.definition: a person or place in relation to others near or next to it
meanings.sent1: The grocery store is my favorite neighbor in the shopping plaza.
meanings.sent2: The park is a peaceful neighbor to the bustling city streets.
meanings.sent3: The loud music from the party was a neighbor to my quiet evening at home.
meanings.sent4: In a crowded room, silence can be a welcome neighbor.
meanings.sent5: The neighbor building's bright lights illuminated the dark alleyway.

meanings.definition: to be situated next to or near something
meanings.sent1: The school is located right next to the neighbor park.
meanings.sent2: The coffee shop is conveniently situated near the neighbor bookstore.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat on the windowsill, looking out at the neighbor garden.
meanings.sent4: The old oak tree stood proudly beside its neighbor, the river.
meanings.sent5: The cozy cabin nestled among the trees, a neighbor to the flowing stream.
